column5: After a day of feeling like crap, I had a night to rest and recover, so, I had the opportunity to fish Simcoe today, it was rough and tough, but we managed some nice fish.  Most fish landed on jerkbaits and tubes in 18-20 feet of water.    Our biggest 5 would have been around 22-23 pounds

Very nice Steve but you know as people focus on my yellow big bird suit(Mustang Survival suit)  I have to say nice Blue suit Papa Smurf  Sorry Steve its just a diversion from a yellow suit to a blue suit
Unfortunately, with polarized glasses on, its purple.  I get Barney a lot!  LOL

I happen to like the blue... it brings out the Hugh Jass bass in you! If I can't make it to Quinte at least I'll be able to see Mike (Big Bird) via satellite. Nice fish Steve, I'm glad you were rewarded for dealing with the weather. -Brian
Thats some sweet bronze right there. Nice haul man!
Now whats stopping you Brian from going to Quinte yout boat is paid for and you have the $$$$$$$ so tell the wife you need to see the other family and come on down
It wasnt purple under the store lights!!
Great going Steve.... some real nice bronze backs Leechman
Well done steve !!!!...some very nice smallies bud,  that would have been a nice tourney weight too !!!...cheers
Nice stuff Steve, you sure do own that lake!
Nice smallmouths man!  Thanks for the report.

Nice Fish Steve, you really do have that lake diald. Isn't that my boat??? lol!!! That was certainly a fun afternoon, only 12 fish. You had me beat but couldent seal the deal, my 2 back to back at the end to tie it up was clutch. Now leave them alone till tourney day.
Right on dude!  no arguing that you've got simcoe dialed in!  cheers, UF
LOL! And all hail the man that taught me what I know on this wonderful lake!
